name: Clin T NET Small Intestine
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:** TNM does not include an in situ category for small intestine Neuroendocrine (NET) Tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ tumors.

**Note 2:**  Ignore intraluminal or lateral extension to adjacent segment(s) of small intestine and code depth of invasion or spread outside the small intestine as indicated.

**Note 3:**  The nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue is, for jejunum and ileum, part of the mesentery and, for duodenum in areas where serosa is lacking, part of the retroperitoneum.
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated 
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary
Tumor invades lamina propria or submucosa and is no greater than 1 cm in size

Invasion into:
     Lamina propria, including lamina propria in a polyp
     Submucosa (superficial invasion) including submucosa in a polyp

Confined to:
     Mucosa, NOS, including intramucosal, NOS
      Muscularis mucosae, including muscularis mucosae in a polyp

Intraluminal spread to other segments of small intestine or cecum

 Localized, NOS

Stated as T1
Tumor invades muscularis propria or is greater than 1 cm in size

Muscularis propria invaded

Stated as T2

Jejunal or ileal tumor invades subserosa
Ampullary or duodenal tumor invades pancreas or retro-
peritoneum

Invasion through muscularis propria or muscularis, NOS
Extension through wall, NOS
Subserosal tissue/(sub)serosal fat invaded
Transmural, NOS

Fat, NOS

Adjacent connective tissue
Mesentery, including mesenteric fat less than or equal to 2 centimeters (cm) in depth or NOS
Nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue less than or equal to 2 cm in depth or NOS

For duodenum primary only (C170):
    Ampulla of Vater
    Pancreas
    Pancreatic duct
    Retroperitoneum less than or equal to 2 cm in depth or NOS
    Retroperitoneum invaded greater than 2 cm in depth
 
Mesentery invaded greater than 2 cm in depth
Nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue invaded greater than 2 cm in depth
  
Stated as T3
Tumor perforates visceral peritoneum (serosa) or invades other organs or adjacent structures

Invasion of/through serosa(mesothelium)(tunica serosa) (visceral peritoneum)

For all small intestine sites:
   Abdominal wall
   Other segments of the small intestine via serosa

    Blood vessel(s), major:
        Aorta
        Gastroduodenal artery
        Portal vein
        Renal vein
        Superior mesenteric artery or vein
        Vena cava
    Diaphragm

    Hepatic flexure
    Kidney, NOS

    Liver, NOS

    Liver, right lobe
    Omentum, NOS
    Stomach
    Transverse colon
    Ureter, right
 
For jejunum or ileum primary only (C171, C172):
    Bladder
    Colon, including appendix
    Fallopian tube
    Ovary
    Retroperitoneum invaded greater than 2cm in depth
    Uterus

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4

Clinical T is not defined for this site/histology
